intro: Silene apetala var. berenicea, commonly known as the Berenice's catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Silene apetala var. berenicea is known for its low-growing habit and is often found in disturbed or marginal environments.
